Edit: Welcome to Dead by buglight, I mean, Daylight, a game where bugs and dedicated servers are the worst enemy for both sides(survivors and killers), a game where all  12+ are telling you that they sleep with your mom or your dad and think that OchiDooDoo, Ayrun, Jrm, Ussylis(and other "pro" streamers) are the best.

I absolutely love this game! I have almost 800 hours of play into this game and I can honestly say I have had a lot of fun playing this, almost more than any other game I've played. Sure the community can be toxic/mean, but c'mon...that's with any online game that you will EVER play. It doesn't matter if you're playing CoD, Marvel vs Capcom, F13 The Game, etc...you're going to find toxicity in every...single...community...its an online game, there are people who are going to be toxic, learn to ignore it and get over it. Are you really going to let someone ruin your fun? The dev's take a lot of time to sit back and actually look at the game and see what its players want, I mean, why else would the have Streams to talk about new things or Q&A sessions for the players so they can ask questions and give us straight answers? They actually listen and want to make this game better than ever. I would love to see more positivity coming from people and have more fun with it, just don't let the trolls get to you. If you're into horror and love this stlye of play, then this game is definately for you! See you in the Fog!

Fun game to play when you want to solo instead of with friends but also a good game to play with friends. Nice tension relaxer and still some "oh crap" moments.

The killers that have been added have been awesome, cant wait to see what they add in next.

Price is good as well. I think it is a good game to have in your inventory. There is no in game chat but i think for this style of game it adds to it instead of taken it away.

Best Horor multiplayer game I ever play. It is better than Friday the 13 . I want to see jason in dead by daylight is for me very powerful killer and I want to fix the Freedy Krugger. You must buy this game because is so fun to play with friends.

Dead by Daylight is a fun-packed, family friendly adventure where one helpless villain gets viciously harassed by four blood-starved heroes. Most of the time.
Game that is good for health

Very good personality simulator.
You can try out what it's like being a socially awkward/introvert person. When a survivor meets the killer, she's like "Oh, no, get away! Leave me alone!" and you jump through a window.
When you are the killer, you can try an outgoing personality. You roam casualy than meet someone and you're like "Hi there! Was looking for you! How are you? Let me get you comfy on that hook". And you are happy for every encounter.
10/10

I wouldn't recommend this game as anything other than a game to play with four other friends. It suffers from numerous issues that make it extremely unfun, and borderline unplayable at times, because it pretty much relies on sportsmanship from the killer

Firstly, if you get captured, the killer may very well stare at you until you die. Since you are playing with randoms, chances are they won't save you, and you die there. Or they save you and take your place, and they suffer the same fate. They may also not take advantage of this, since you cannot communicate with them, and thus tell them to do something else, and they may very well just straight up watch you die with no benefit. Even if three other players take full advantage of this 'strategy', the one player left to eat shit is... Well, left to eat shit. This completely kills the game for whoever gets captured

Secondly, relying on strangers you cannot talk to. You cannot write while ingame, nor is there a mic option allowing you to talk to players while nearby, so you are essentially playing a mute. This means that you have to rely more or less entirely on moving around like a moron while trying to suggest that you want to get healed

Third. Imagine you start a game, which is intended to be four players. Now two of them disconnects. There's pretty much 0 chance of victory in any other way than using the hatch, which is limited to one player anyways

Fourth. The hatch is a complete pain to find because there's no indication of where it is, meaning you have to blindly roam, or simply KNOW where it is, which messes with newer players and does nothing for veterans of the series

Fifth. There doesn't always seem to be an indicator of which killer you're against. Sometimes you'll get tips on the loading screen to give it away, and then other times, nothing

Sixth. The mechanics, such as being trapped by the pig are pretty much not explained, so unless you research every single killer through and through, you're boned

Seventh. Some maps feel heavily favourable for the killer, because there's little terrain to hide behind, and no way to outmaneuver them. This feels sluggish. The open, large maps with fog are the best ones, because it gives more room for movement, without completely gutting either sides. The Saw-based map? If you get seen, you're basically dead. There's too many dead ends with walls, and corners to get stuck in, and VERY few longer segments to break free from the chase. While outrunning the chaser is nigh impossible in general, at least the more open maps give an opportunity, where as indoor segments are a death trap

As a result, it can be very fun if you have four other players who are friends, whom you can talk to, and have fun with while laughing at the mistakes and death, but all of the issues mentioned above will put a rather abrupt halt to it, and they are rather prominent when playing with randoms
